problem: Six horses eat 12 bales of hay in 12 hours. At the same rate, how many hours will 36 bales of hay last 12 horses?
solution: From the original rate, we note that 12 horses will eat 12 bales of hay in 6 hours. (Double the number of horses, half the time)  Therefore, 12 horses will eat 36 bales of hay in $\boxed{18\text{ hours}}$. (Triple the amount of hay, triple the time)
model_solution:
First step: Six horses eat 12 bales of hay in 12 hours.
Six horses eat 2 bales of hay in 12 hours.
Six horses eat 1 bale of hay in 12 hours.
Thirteen horses eat 1 bale of hay in 12 hours.
Six horses eat 1 bale of hay in 12 hours.
 Twelve horses eat 1 bale of hay in 9 hours.
 Twelve horses eat 36 bales of hay in 324 hours.
Twelve horses eat 36 bales of hay in 324 hours.
Twelve horses eat 36 bales of hay in 324 hours.

(No, this is not the final answer)

 Twelve horses eat 36 bales of hay in 324/36 hours.
